meanings.definition: A person or thing that interrupts.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, one of the interrupters kept asking questions.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the interrupters to raise their hands before speaking.
meanings.sent3: The interrupters in the movie were always bursting into conversations at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter acted as an interrupter to the serious discussion.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog served as an annoying interrupter during the presentation.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that interrupts a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The electrical interrupters in the house prevent overloading the circuits.
meanings.sent2: The power outage was caused by a faulty interrupter in the main circuit.
meanings.sent3: The interrupters in the circuit board worked tirelessly to regulate the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent4: The interrupter acted like a gatekeeper, controlling the flow of current.
meanings.sent5: The interrupter tripped, causing the lights to flicker unexpectedly.
